content: Acceptable Halloween Candies for Dialysis Patients ✓ Avoid These Candies X Candy Corn, Sweet Tarts, Red Licorice Chocolate candy bars Bulls-eye, Marshmallows, Sour Balls Chocolate and nut candy bars Butterscotch, Gummy Bears Candy bars that contain nuts Jolly Ranchers, Jelly Beans Candy bars with peanut butter Gum Drops, Peppermint Toffee JuJu Beans, Lifesavers Caramel treats Red Hots, Lemon Drops Chocolate wafer candy bars Lemon Heads, Chewing Gums Chocolate covered peppermint candies Phosphorus and Potassium Content of Different Candies Food Potassium (Mg) Phosphorus (Mg) Food Potassium (Mg) Phosphorus (Mg) Lollipop 0 0 Brownie (1 large square) 83 57 Lifesavers 0 0 Chocolate cake doughnut 64 97 Candy corn (1/4 C) 2 3 Almond Joy (1.7 oz) 120 69 Taffy (.5 oz) 1 0 Mounds (1.9 oz) 111 64 Skittles (2.3 oz) 3 1 Twix (2 oz) 115 68 Starburst fruit chews (6) 1 4 Kit Kat (1.5 oz) 126 73 Gumdrops (10 small) 2 0 M & M’s (1.69 oz) 128 72 Jelly beans (10 large) 10 1 Caramels (6 pieces) 152 81 Toffee (.42 oz) 6 4 M & M’ s peanut (1.74 oz) 169 93 Apple cider (from mix) 1 27 Raisinettes (1.58 oz) 231 65 York Peppermint Patty
title: Halloween for Dialysis Patients: Tips for a Safe Celebration
